com.augursystems.armi

Interface Client


  • public interface Client
    This interface is implemented by ARMI clients that want to receive asynchronous data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort(java.lang.String reason)
      Called when there's a problem, for example, when the connection to the remote server dies before we receive the expected call response.
      void handlePacket(Packet p)
      Called when a subscribed Packet arrives for this Client.

    • Method Detail

      • handlePacket

        void handlePacket(Packet p)
        Called when a subscribed Packet arrives for this Client. Usually, you will call Packet.decodeInstance() to get the Serializable object wrapped by the Packet. Alternatively, you might call Packet.getData() if the Packet contains a raw byte[], instead of an object.

        If you have multiple subscriptions (or expect multiple flavors), you will have to interrogate the Packet via its getDataType() and getDataFlavor() methods.

        Parameters:
        p - A Packet that matched a subscription of yours.

      • abort

        void abort(java.lang.String reason)
        Called when there's a problem, for example, when the connection to the remote server dies before we receive the expected call response.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason to document why; must be non-null else abort ignored.
